DataElement.preferredName: Second Line Treatment Bevacizumab Maintenance Therapy Occurrence Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Text term to signify whether a patient received second line maintenance bevacizumab therapy.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Second Line Treatment Bevacizumab Maintenance Therapy Occurrence
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The second preferred therapy for a particular condition, used after first-line treatment fails or if a person cannot tolerate first-line drugs._A recombinant humanized monoclonal antibody directed against the vascular endothelial growth factor (VEGF), a pro-angiogenic cytokine._Continuation of treatment for an extended period of time to prevent relapse._An instance of something happening, such as an event or incident.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Second Line Treatment Bevacizumab Maintenance Therapy
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition:
The second preferred therapy for a particular condition, used after first-line treatment fails or if a person cannot tolerate first-line drugs.
:A monoclonal antibody that may prevent the growth of blood vessels from surrounding tissue to a solid tumor.:Treatment that is given to help a primary (original) treatment keep working. Maintenance therapy is often given to help keep cancer in remission.

Concepts.definition: The second preferred therapy for a particular condition, used after first-line treatment fails or if a person cannot tolerate first-line drugs.

A recombinant humanized monoclonal antibody directed against the vascular endothelial growth factor (VEGF), a pro-angiogenic cytokine.  Bevacizumab binds to VEGF and inhibits VEGF receptor binding, thereby preventing the growth and maintenance of tumor blood vessels.
Continuation of treatment for an extended period of time to prevent relapse.

Property.preferredDefinition: Occurrence; an instance of something happening.

Concepts.definition: An instance of something happening, such as an event or incident.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.
